oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christopher Ammons near Saigon with five other soldiers
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons with five unidentified members of 3rd Platoon, Company A, 1st Battalion, 16th Infantry, 1st Infantry Division. Ammons is at the back row, left, wearing glasses. Two soldiers are kneeling in front; three men are shirtless. There are tents behind them and to their left. The soldier next to Ammons is holding an ammunition belt.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men
United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Saigon (Vietnam); Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam. Saigon was renamed Ho Chi Minh City in 1975 after the Vietnamese Communist leader Ho Chi Minh.
